Articles.Content:
You know the new in game currency does not have a name as far as I know so post your ideas in the comments and maybe Squad will pick a name.

Here's mine: Kerbollars
They do have a name. FundsÃ¢â‚¬â€¹ is the officially-sanctioned name for the currency.

*goes to the store*

"I'd like a pack of crisps, please"

"That'd be 2.59 funds."

"I have 3 funds"

"Here's 0.45 funds"

It really sounds silly

The grammar National Socialist in me cannot bring myself to call them "funds". I've been using "kerbucks" mentally, though any reasonable alternative to "funds" is almost guaranteed to be better in my mind.
'Funds' does sounds a tad bit off. I've been using "kredits" for the unit and "kash" for whatever I have on hand.
My flags mostly mention : "We did it for the K-money"
Starbucks.

The grammar National Socialist in me cannot bring myself to call them "funds". I've been using "kerbucks" mentally, though any reasonable alternative to "funds" is almost guaranteed to be better in my mind.

Ditto. "Funds" are...awkward.

No idea why they didn't go with Kerbucks or Kredits or somesuch. If they didn't want cuteness and K-puns in the game, then they shouldn't have spent several years including them.
Roots (Ã¢Ë†Å¡).

*goes to the store*

"I'd like a pack of crisps, please"

"That'd be 2.59 funds."

"I have 3 funds"

"Here's 0.45 funds"

It really sounds silly

MATHS. So much maths here.
Kronas of course
Kwon - Rod Tidwell reference except with the K spelling.
Kerching - Inspired by Kerbals and the sound of a cash register.

Funds are the Root (Ã¢Ë†Å¡) of all evil. Gathering too many Roots (Ã¢Ë†Å¡) will summon the kraken, or at least let wackjob build something big enough to do so. We must stop gathering them before its too late

I just call em funds or roots simply because the first is what squad called them and the second is what they used as the symbol for them.
Just 'cause they use the square root symbol, doesn't mean they aren't dollars/bucks.

Keeping with KSP's origin and the slight tendency of using the letter 'K' the official currency would of course be the Keso.

(Even if it sounds a bit cheesy to some)
Kerboleons.

Keeping with KSP's origin and the slight tendency of using the letter 'K' the official currency would of course be the Keso.

(Even if it sounds a bit cheesy to some)

What you did. It's there. And I see it.

For my own part, I heard somebody call them "spesos" which I thought was brilliant, but my brain just won't let go of "kerbucks."

*goes to the store*

"I'd like a pack of crisps, please"

"That'd be 2.59 funds."

"I have 3 funds"

"Here's 0.45 funds"

It really sounds silly

He's long changed you!

Keeping with KSP's origin and the slight tendency of using the letter 'K' the official currency would of course be the Keso.

(Even if it sounds a bit cheesy to some)

Boy is that a carne joke!

I refuse to give into K-Syndrome, myself, so most of those suggested currency names don't do a thing for me. I kinda like the idea of calling them Roots, what with the currency sign being what it is, but I honestly don't mind Funds all that much either. It has a certain charm, as with that old NES game Faxanadu where the currency was golds (yes, in plural like that; shopkeepers infamously informed you when you were under-funded that "this is not enough golds").

In keeping with Squad's desire not to go down the "K" route for naming the currency the first non-K thought I came up with is:

Essarbee

Because the more Essarbees we earn, the more SRBs we can buy! And everyone knows that if at first you don't succeed you add more boosters!
I call them Kerbal Pounds.
Perhaps we should call them kwatloos?
No one has said Kredits?
